metadata.title: CVE-2016-7398 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A type confusion vulnerability in the merge_param() function ofphp_http_params.c in PHP's pecl-http extension 3.1.0beta2 (PHP 7) andearlier as well as 2.6.0beta2 (PHP 5) and earlier allows attackers to crashPHP and possibly execute arbitrary code via crafted HTTP requests.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7398` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-http - 3.1.0+2.6.0-4build8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: php-pecl-http package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.0+2.6.0-4build8').
